verses.verse: {A Prayer for Judging the Wicked} d {Psalms 9 & 10 constitute a single psalm in the LXX.} Why do you stand far away, LORD ? Why do you hide in times of distress?
The wicked one arrogantly pursues the afflicted, {Or the poor} who are trapped in the schemes he devises.
For the wicked one boasts about his own desire; he blesses the greedy and despises the LORD .
With haughty arrogance, the wicked thinks, "God will not seek justice." {The Heb. lacks justice} He always presumes "There is no God."
Their ways always seem prosperous. Your judgments are on high, far away from them. They scoff at all their enemies.
They say to themselves, "We will not be moved throughout all time, and we will not experience adversity."
Their mouth is full of curses, lies, and oppression, their tongues {Lit. under his tongue} spread trouble and iniquity.
They wait {Lit. sit} in ambush in the villages, they kill the innocent in secret.
Their eyes secretly watch the helpless, lying in wait like a lion in his den. They lie in wait to catch the afflicted. They catch the afflicted when they pull him into their net.
The victim {Lit. He} is crushed, and he sinks down; the helpless fall by their might.
The wicked say to themselves, "God has forgotten, he has hidden his face, he will never see it."
Rise up, LORD ! Raise your hand, God. Don't forget the afflicted!
Why do the wicked despise God and say to themselves, "God {Lit. He} will not seek justice." ? {The Heb. lacks justice}
But you do see! You take note of trouble and grief in order to take the matter into your own hand. The helpless one commits himself {The Heb. lacks himself} to you; you have been the orphan's helper.
Break the arm of the wicked and evil man; so that when you seek out his wickedness you will find it no more.
The LORD is king forever and ever; nations will perish from his land.
LORD , you heard the desire of the afflicted; you will strengthen them, {Lit. strengthen their heart} you will listen carefully,
to do justice for the orphan {Or fatherless} and the oppressed, so that men of the earth may cause terror no more.
